quest.name: It's Not Mud
journal:
 Quest Sync
Emaniette seeks a brave soul for a dangerous task.
objectives: Deliver the brown mud to Emaniette.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: If I'm not mistaken, you have the steely eyes of an adventurer. One who looks death in the eye and does not flinch.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: It just so happens that I require a sample of rare earth, but it can only be found in a location rife with vicious plants and gods know what else. I would give you a hefty sack of coin if you could retrieve it for me.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: If you are willing, pray make your way to Troglophile's Deep and gather for me three samples of brown mud─the darker, the better, I say. I suggest sharpening your weapons beforehand, but I won't tell you how to do your job.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: I require three samples of brown mud from Troglophile's Deep. They should be easy to spot, but reaching them unscathed may be another matter entirely.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: You've returned! Am I surprised? No, no, of course not. I had the utmost faith in your abilities. Well, did you bring the samples?

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: Excellent work. With this, I shall continue my research into the techniques of the Nagxian, skilled fighters and farmers both.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: I recently acquired texts from their homeland that go into some detail about their agriculture. Did you know they mix bat droppings into the soil to make it more fertile? Quite ingenious.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: The land they live in is quite temperate, and it is writ that after one hundred summers the droppings solidify into something resembling stone, further concentrating the nutrients contained within.

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: Of course, the samples you've provided me today are far too ripe to be of much use on their own. However, what is the purpose of research if not to free us from the bounds of the natural world?

dialogue.name: EMANIETTE
dialogue.text: What's that? Of course, I'm sure I said that the droppings resemble mud, didn't I? Regardless, I aim to speed up the ripening process, creating in days what takes nature centuries to accomplish. If I succeed, farmers across the realm will rejoice, and they will have you to thank for it!

obj.n: The Full Report, Warts and All
